Naturalis OAI-PMH REST services framework

Java framework for hosting and exposing multiple OAI repositories through a single REST service. New OAI repositories can be added by dropping the jar file containing the repository implementation into the web server's classpath. The REST service will automatically pick them up. Repository implementations don't need to be aware of the web context within which they are used. The only need a dependency on nl.naturalis.oaipmh.api.jar which itself does not have any JAX-RS related classes or dependencies.

Implementing an OAI repository

To create an OAI repository and expose it through the REST service, you must create a Java library containing at least:

  1. A class implementing the IOAIRepository interface
  2. A Java properties file called oai-repo.<your-repo-name>.properties. You can choose any repository name you like. If you choose the name "foo" for your OAI repository, and the base URL of the REST service is http://example.com/home, then your repository can be accessed at http://example.com/home/foo (e.g. http://example.com/home/foo/?verb=ListRecord&metadataPrefix=oai_dc). The properties file must be on the web server's classpath (e.g. the src/main/resources directory of your library) and it must contain at least one property: repo.impl.class, specifying the fully qualified name of the class within your library that implements the IOAIRepository interface.

Eclipse set-up

To create an OAI repository using Eclipse, create a new (standard) Java Project. Retrieve jar file containing the API classes from github and put it on your project's build path (using Build Path -> Configure Build Path). Alternatively, you can also add the Eclipse project for the API classes to your workspace and let your project depend on it.

Packages 
Package Description
nl.naturalis.oaipmh.api
Interfaces and classes defining the interface between the REST layer and OAI repository implementations.
nl.naturalis.oaipmh.api.util
Classes that can aid in implementing an OAI repository.
nl.naturalis.oaipmh.rest
REST application classes and classes mediating between the REST layer and the OAI repository.
org.openarchives.oai._2  
org.openarchives.oai._2_0.oai_dc  
org.purl.dc.elements._1
